total_revenue.context: Q3 2021 revenue was $5.42 billion, up 19% year-over-year in constant currency.

Marketing_and_Commerce_Cloud.context: Marketing and Commerce Cloud grew 25% year-over-year.

gaap.context: Q3 GAAP Earnings Per Share was $1.15.

non_gaap.context: Q3 non-GAAP Earnings Per Share was $1.74.

operating_cash_flow.context: Operating cash flow was $339 million, up 14% year-over-year.

free_cash_flow.context: Free cash flow was $215 million, up 68% year-over-year.

capital_expenditures.context: CapEx for the quarter was $124 million, leading to free cash flow of $215 million.

ai_predictions.context: Einstein delivered more than 80 billion AI-powered predictions every day across Customer 360.

marketing_messages.context: Customers are delivering an average of 2.6 billion marketing messages daily.

sales_leads.context: Customers are generating 4 million sales leads daily.

customer_service_conversations.context: Logging 19.7 million customer service conversations daily.

commerce_orders.context: Commerce Cloud processed more than 31 million orders during Cyber Week, up 62% year-over-year.

market_position.description: Salesforce remains the #1 CRM provider by market share for the seventh year in a row.
initiatives: Maintaining leadership in CRM across sales, service, marketing, commerce, communities, integration, and app development.
Expanding Customer 360 platform through organic growth and acquisitions.
goals: Drive growth through innovation and platform expansion.
examples: Acquisitions of Tableau, Salesforce.org, ClickSoftware, Vlocity.
Customer 360 platform enhancements.

innovation.description: Focus on Customer 360 and AI innovations.
initiatives: Customer 360 providing unified customer views across sales, service, marketing, commerce, and communities.
Customer 360 Truth connecting all data across Salesforce platforms.
Einstein Voice Skills enabling voice-powered Salesforce apps.
Salesforce Blockchain introducing location-based services.
Trailhead reskilling platform expanding to 1.8 million learners.
Partnership with Southern New Hampshire University for Trailhead college credit.
goals: Empower customers with AI and blockchain capabilities.
Drive workforce development and ecosystem growth.
examples: Customer 360 Truth enabling integrated, single source of truth for customers.
Einstein Voice Skills allowing voice queries like 'Hey Einstein, what's my forecast?'.
Trailhead empowering 1.8 million learners and contributing to 4.2 million jobs and $1.2 trillion in new business revenues.

tableau.description: Integration of Tableau into Salesforce ecosystem.
initiatives: Enhancing data visualization and analytics capabilities.
goals: Leverage Tableau for advanced business intelligence.
examples: Tableau contributing approximately $327 million to Q3 revenue.
Tableau contributing approximately $308 million to Q4 revenue.
Integration benefiting customers like Nissan, Morgan Stanley, Home Depot.

initiatives: Enhancing nonprofit and education support.
Integrating Salesforce.org into Salesforce structure.
goals: Empower nonprofit, education, and philanthropy customers.
examples: Salesforce.org contributing approximately $80 million to Q4 revenue.
Integration completed in Q4 2020.

clicksoftware.description: Acquisition of ClickSoftware to enhance field service capabilities.
initiatives: Delivering greater field service innovation.
examples: FOX Sports choosing Field Service Lightning.

vlocity.description: Acquisition of Vlocity to enhance industry-specific solutions.
initiatives: Delivering powerful industry-specific clouds and mobile app solutions.
examples: Vlocity contributing approximately $50 million in revenue for fiscal '21.
Partnerships with top companies like State Farm, ENGIE, Louis Vuitton.

ecosystem_development.description: Growth of Salesforce ecosystem through Trailhead and partnerships.
initiatives: Trailhead online learning and reskilling platform.
My Trailhead for customers to create branded learning experiences.
Strategic partnerships with global brands like IBM, Amazon, Microsoft, Alibaba.
goals: Create more than 3 million jobs and $860 billion in GDP impact worldwide by 2022.
Provide over 1 million Americans with Salesforce credentials.
Contribute to 4.2 million new jobs and $1.2 trillion in new business revenues worldwide from 2019 through 2024.
examples: Accenture leveraging My Trailhead for employee reskilling.
Telstra adopting My Trailhead.
Partnership with Alibaba to support multinational customers.

social_initiatives.description: Salesforce.org integration and enhanced nonprofit support.
initiatives: Integrating Salesforce.org into Salesforce structure.
Supporting more than 44,000 nonprofit and higher education customers.
Delivering nearly $300 million in grants and 4.3 million volunteer hours.
Achieving net 0 gas emissions globally.
Delivering a carbon-neutral cloud to customers.
Committing to 100% renewable energy for global operations by 2022.
goals: Empower nonprofit, education, and philanthropy customers to fulfill their missions.
Reduce environmental impact and promote sustainability.
examples: Salesforce.org now fully part of Salesforce.
Supporting nonprofit customers with unified services.
$330 million in grants to worthy causes.
Employees delivering 4.9 million hours of volunteerism.
46,000 nonprofits and NGOs using Salesforce software for free.
Carbon-neutral cloud and commitment to renewable energy.

revenue_growth.expectation: Robust organic and acquisition-driven growth with continued demand for CRM solutions.
revenue_growth.constant_currency_growth: Expected to remain strong or accelerate in upcoming quarters.
factors: Growth in Salesforce platform and cloud services.
Increased demand for digital transformation and customer experience solutions.

q1_fy_2022.context: Q1 FY '22 revenue guidance of $5.68 billion to $5.715 billion, up approximately 17% year-over-year.

core_trends: Continued investment in cloud and AI.
Strategic acquisitions to enhance product offerings.

operating_environment_challenges: Integration of Salesforce.org, Tableau, ClickSoftware, Vlocity.
Managing FX headwinds impacting revenue growth.
Balancing investments in cloud and AI with profitability.
Adapting to competitive pressures in cloud and CRM markets.
Scaling operations to support rapid growth in key segments like Sales Cloud and Service Cloud.
